summary: This is an email exchange between a Bureau of Prisons official and attorney Jonathan Savella regarding approval for Jeffrey Epstein to receive a CPAP machine at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The email shows logistical coordination for medical equipment delivery shortly before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jonathan Savella
persons.context: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who is inquiring about approval and delivery procedures for Epstein's CPAP machine at the correctional facility.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Incarcerated individual at Metropolitan Correctional Center who requires a CPAP machine, referenced by his inmate number 76318-054.

connections.description: Savella is acting as Epstein's attorney, coordinating delivery of medical equipment to him while incarcerated.

events.title: CPAP Machine Approval Request
events.description: Attorney Jonathan Savella inquires about approval for Jeffrey Epstein to receive a CPAP machine at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, with BOP staff confirming approval and delivery procedures.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied as incarceration location)
810 Seventh Ave., Ste. 620, New York, NY 10019 (Jonathan Savella's law office address)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was approved to receive a CPAP machine while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in July 2019.
The Bureau of Prisons required the CPAP machine to be delivered to medical staff rather than directly to Epstein through inmate mail.
This correspondence occurred on July 26, 2019, just weeks before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
Attorney Jonathan Savella was actively managing logistical details for Epstein's medical needs while he was in custody.
